sen.j: 北条 政範（ほうじょう まさのり、文治5年（1189年） - 元久元年11月5日 (旧暦)（1204年11月27日）は鎌倉時代初期の武将。
sen.e: Masanori HOJO (1189-November 27, 1204) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 父は北条時政、母は時政の後妻で正室の牧の方。
sen.e: His father was Tokimasa HOJO and his mother was Maki no kata (Lady Maki), the second lawful wife of Tokimasa.

sen.j: 母が京の出身と言うこともあり、3代将軍源実朝が都の貴族である坊門信清の娘を正室に迎える際の使者として上洛した。
sen.e: Since his mother was from Kyoto, he went to Kyoto as an envoy when MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, the 3rd shogun, welcomed the daughter of Nobukiyo Bomon, a noble in Kyoto, as his lawful wife.

sen.j: 若年での官位の高さなどから見て、時政の嫡男は異母兄の北条義時ではなく、貴族出身である牧の方を母とする政範であったと見られる。
sen.e: Judging from his high official court rank for a man of his age, it is considered that Tokimasa's heir was Masanori whose mother, Maki no kata, was from a noble family, rather than Yoshitoki HOJO who was Masanori's older brother by a different mother.

Judging from his high official court rank for a man of his age, it is considered that Tokimasa's legitimate son was Masanori whose mother, Maki no kata, was from a noble family, rather than Yoshitoki HOJO who was Masanori's older paternal half-brother.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Judging from his high official court rank for a man of his age, it is considered that Tokimasa's legitimate son was Masanori whose mother, Maki no kata, was from a noble family, rather than Yoshitoki HOJO who was Masanori's older paternal half-brother.

sen.j: 時政・牧の方鍾愛の子であった政範の死は、畠山重忠の乱、牧氏事件と続く鎌倉幕府、北条氏一族内紛のきっかけとなっている。
sen.e: The death of Masanori who was favored by Tokimasa and Maki no kata triggered internal conflicts in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), i.e., among the members of the Hojo clan, such as Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion and Makishi Incident.
